column3:
Where's the car waiting?
{{c1::At}} the traffic lights.

Where's the fly?
{{c1::On}} his arm.

Where are the shelves?
{{c1::On}} the wall.

Where's the Eiffel Tower?
{{c1::In}} Paris.

Where is the woman standing?
{{c1::At}} the door.

Where's the notice?
{{c1::On}} the door.

Where's the key?
{{c1::In}} the door.

Where's the man standing?
{{c1::At}} the gate.

Where's the bird?
{{c1::On}} the gate.
Nicola was wearing a silver ring {{c1::on}} her little finger.
I wasn't sure it was the right office. There was no name {{c1::on}} the door.
She was holding something {{c1::in}} her hand, but I couldn't see what it was.
Leave the motorway {{c1::at}} junction14, and then turn left.
How much does it cost to leave your car {{c1::in}} the hotel car park?
Emily was sitting {{c1::on}} the balcony reading a book.
The man the police are looking for has a scar {{c1::on}} his right cheek.
When you get to the airport, you'll have to check in {{c1::at}} desk 20.
I like that picture hanging {{c1::on}} the wall.
There was a long queue of people {{c1::at}} the bus stop.
The weather forecast is {{c1::on}} page 18 of the newspaper.

Where does Sue work?
{{c1::In}} the sales department.

Sue lives in this building. Where's her flat exactly?
{{c1::On}} the second floor.

Where's the cat?
{{c1::At}} the top of the stairs.

Where's the dog?
{{c1::In}} the back of the car.

Liz is in this picture. Where is she?
{{c1::At}} the front.

Where's the post office?
{{c1::On}} the left.

Gary is in the cinema. Where is he sitting?
{{c1::In}} the back row.

Where is the woman standing?
{{c1::On|At}} the corner.

Where is the man standing?
{{c1::In}} the corner.
